ranked_diseases.explanation: Perfect match with all three reference cases. Patient shows all core features: lipodystrophy affecting limbs and trunk, type II diabetes, pancreatitis, hypertriglyceridemia, hypercholesterolemia, and hepatic steatosis. Age of presentation (21 years) is typical for FPLD2.

Similar phenotype to FPLD2 with partial lipodystrophy, metabolic complications including diabetes and dyslipidemia. However, FPLD3 typically has more prominent facial sparing which is not specified in this patient.
Shares features of partial lipodystrophy and metabolic syndrome, but typically presents with additional muscular symptoms and myopathy which are not reported in this patient.
While it shares metabolic features, CGL1 typically presents from birth with more severe, generalized lipodystrophy rather than the partial pattern seen in this patient.
Similar to CGL1, this condition presents with congenital onset and generalized lipodystrophy, making it less likely given the partial pattern and likely later onset in this patient.

Can present with similar metabolic complications but typically shows a cephalocaudal pattern of fat loss and is often associated with autoimmune features or complement abnormalities not mentioned here.
